Creating two new pension schemes , the risk weakening the financial resources one or the other , might be too hot a political potato , even the pursuit faster broadband . The suspect appeared the Old Bailey accused failing to contact a monitoring company and report a police station twice January . The Home Office has refused to comment the case . TPims replaced control orders January 2012 . The suspect - who can only be referred BM - was one nine British citizens subject a TPim when the figures were last disclosed March . The BBC is not aware anyone else who has appeared court charged a breach a TPim . The Home Office said : \" We do not comment individual cases . The police investigate all breaches TPims and will prosecute where that is viable . \" Those subject a TPim can be ordered to stay overnight a specified address and report a police station every day . Other measures include a ban contacting particular individuals , going certain areas and places and travelling abroad . Labour has argued TPims have \" weakened \" public protection terrorism . March , the independent reviewer terror laws , David Anderson , said TPims could prove less effective control orders they can be imposed a maximum period two years only . The court heard BM is charged two counts breaching Section 23 a TPim order . The allegations are 16 January he failed to contact a monitoring company , and 27 January failed to report a police station . BM , who has a grey beard and was dressed the hearing a white shirt , cannot be named nor have his address published legal reasons . The prosecutor Louise Gray asked a provisional date 2 July to be set a plea and case management hearing . The defendant was granted unconditional bail he remains subject the restrictions imposed his TPim . But critics say it could put more people work employers might not be able to afford the higher wages . The government says it will consult the issue , but hopes to introduce a minimum wage two years . Announcing the rate , which was proposed a panel advisers , the country 's deputy president Cyril Ramaphosa said : \" We are now a step closer finalising discussions the national minimum wage . All social partners will now decide what their take is . \" He said the panel was not endorsing the proposed figure a living wage , but wanted to set a minimum payment workers . Wages are politically sensitive the country , where the official unemployment rate is close 25 % . One employment expert reckoned the figure was only about a quarter the amount needed the upkeep a typical South African working-class household . Prof Chris Malikane the University Witwatersrand told a Johannesburg radio station : \" You would need 12,000 rand to sustain a basic household . \" The African National Congress , South Africa 's ruling party , supported the proposal calling it \" credible and clearly supported clear evidence \" . However , the Economic Freedom Fighters , the country 's third largest political party , said the plan \" favours business the expense workers \" . It called a higher minimum wage at least 4,500 rand . South Africa faces a possible downgrade sub-investment grade credit ratings agencies month , concerns remaining violent wage strikes . Moody 's currently rates South Africa two notches subinvestment grade , a negative outlook , Fitch and S & P Global Ratings have it just a step \" junk \" . The Campaign to Protect Rural England ( CPRE ) will put its case a High Court judge 23 October . The five-storey university blocks provide 439 accommodation units . The flats overlook a Site Special Scientific Interest and a Scheduled Ancient Monument . CPRE is seeking the judicial review the basis Oxford City Council not carrying an environmental impact assessment . Natural Resources Minister Carl Sargeant has written councils reminding them the temporary ban fracking Wales . He said fracking technology was \" unproven \" , saying Welsh ministers preferred to look renewable energy . Fracking is a process using high pressure water to break rocks deep underground to release gas and pipe it the surface . It is a major industry the United States , but there are concerns safety , the environment and underground water . There have been protests applications test drilling gas both the Vale Glamorgan and Wrexham , as well sites England . Experts believe , when fully operational , the Yongbyon reactor can make one nuclear bomb 's worth plutonium year . But this government seems to speak two voices housing : the communities department wants to shift the balance power firmly new development places people want to live , but Number 10 and some influential Tory backbenchers are sympathetic the passionate concerns those who wish to protect the countryside and particularly the green belt . The real question that lies all the rhetoric and policy bullet-points is the balance power development and local opposition has fundamentally changed . Ministers now accept England needs 250,000 new homes every year , they have described the housing market \" broken \" and they agree radical change is the only way to mend it . Researchers found firearms and related goods generated 136 sales month and a monthly revenue $ 80,000 ( \u00c2 \u00a3 62,000 ) . The firearms trade has gained attention following recent terrorist attacks . The dark net is a part the internet that requires specific software to access , order users to remain anonymous . the trade was unlikely to fuel large-scale terrorist operations , it had the potential to become the platform choice \" lone-wolf \" terrorists to obtain weapons and ammunition , the report said . Non-profit organisation Rand Corporation Europe , working Manchester University , found 52 unique vendors selling weapons or similar items such ammunition , explosives , or components such silencers 811 listings and 18 markets . Police believe the 2016 Munich shooting , which left nine people dead , used weapons purchased the dark net . Lead author the research , Giacomo Persi Paoli , said : \" Recent high-profile cases have shown the threat posed individuals or small groups obtaining weapons illegally the dark web is real . \" The ability to not only arm criminals and terrorists , who can make virtually anonymous purchases , but also vulnerable and fixated individuals is perhaps the most dangerous aspect . \" Guns account less 1 % items sold the platform , its main trade being narcotics . Nevertheless , the volume being sold \" can be considered sufficiently high to be a cause concern policy makers and law enforcement agencies \" , said the report . The study involved collecting data 12 dark net marketplaces a week September 2016 . Most those selling guns were based the US , but Europe was the most popular destination the weapons they sold . Judith Aldridge , co-investigator the study , said : \" very simple terms , anyone can connect the dark web and minutes have access a variety vendors offering their products , which are most often illegal . \" The dark web enables illegal trade a global level , removing some the geographical barriers vendors and buyers , increasing the personal safety both buyers and sellers a series anonymising features that obscure their identities . \"", "The comedian and actor has been married Malaak Compton-Rock 19 years . Last time he was the US he appeared The View TV programme , where he accepted a marriage proposal his girlfriend , Rebecca Mountain , who lives Massachusetts .", "a study mice , Hsp90 inhibitors were found to strip cancer cells defences hormone treatments . This makes the drugs particularly promising treating drug-resistant cancers , the research team said . Prostate cancer is the most common cancer men the UK . About one eight men will get prostate cancer some point their lives . It mainly affects men the age 50 . The cancer can sometimes be treated successfully hormone treatments , which target androgen receptors linked the growth male hormones called androgens . But some prostate cancers do n't work that way . Instead they create an abnormal form androgen receptor which is not linked the growth hormones and therefore does not respond standard hormone treatment . This is the most common form resistance prostate cancer which leads aggressive , difficult-to-treat cancers . The latest research , published the journal Cancer Research , found a new class drugs reduced production both receptors . Professor Paul Workman , study author and chief executive the Institute Cancer Research , said it was an exciting discovery . \" We call Hsp90 inhibitors ' network drugs' they tackle several the signals that are hijacked cancer all once , a network rather just a single signalling pathway . \" These drugs can hit cancer harder those targeting only one protein , and look promising preventing or overcoming drug resistance . \" Prof Workman said the next step was to test the Hsp90 inhibitors clinical trials patients aggressive , drug-resistant prostate cancer . Prof Johann de Bono , a professor experimental cancer medicine the Institute Cancer Research , said : \" These drugs are already clinical trials several types cancer , and I am excited our work suggests they could also benefit men prostate cancer who have otherwise run treatment options . \"", "\" This will give all European Leagues total freedom to schedule their matches they see fit ,\" said the European Professional Football Leagues group . More Africa Beats", "The team King 's College London say smokers are more likely to develop the disorder and a younger age . Published the Lancet Psychiatry , their analysis 61 separate studies suggests nicotine cigarette smoke may be altering the brain . Experts said it was a \" pretty strong case \" but needed more research . Smoking has long been associated psychosis , but it has often been believed schizophrenia patients are more likely to smoke they use cigarettes a form self-medication to ease the distress hearing voices or having hallucinations . The team King 's looked data involving 14,555 smokers and 273,162 non-smokers . It indicated : The argument is there is a higher rate smoking schizophrenia is diagnosed , then smoking is not simply a case self-medication . Dr James MacCabe , the Institute Psychiatry , Psychology and Neuroscience King 's , said : \" It 's very difficult to establish causation [ this style study ] , what we 're hoping this does is really open our eyes the possibility tobacco could be a causative agent psychosis , and we hope this will then lead other research and clinical trials that would help to provide firmer evidence . \" Clearly most smokers do not develop schizophrenia , but the researchers believe it is increasing the risk . The overall incidence the condition is one every 100 people normally , which may be increased two 100 smoking . The researchers said nicotine altered levels the brain chemical dopamine , which has already been implicated the psychosis . Prof Michael Owen , the director the Institute Psychological Medicine Cardiff University , said the researchers had made a \" pretty strong case \" smoking may increase the risk schizophrenia . \" The fact is it is very hard to prove causation a randomised trial , but there are plenty good reasons already targeting public health measures very energetically the mentally ill . \" The charity Rethink Mental Illness said : \" We know 42 % all cigarettes smoked England are people mental health problems , and so any new findings the link smoking and psychosis is a potential worry . \" However , longer-term studies are needed to fully understand this potential link . \"", "Two crews and a hovercraft Weston-super-Mare were called just midnight to rescue two adults and the children Uphill beach . It is the second year a row the oil company has reported a loss . 2014 , it reported a loss \u00a3 2bn . Tullow also warned there was a risk it could fail to comply its financial covenants this year . Financial covenants are agreements companies make their lenders to maintain a stable financial position . Oil prices have slumped 70 % the middle 2014 , many the oil majors cutting investment exploration and production . That has also led the loss more 5,000 jobs the North Sea oil industry . Tullow said it could cut annual capital expenditure as low $ 300m 2017 , down $ 1.1bn planned 2016 , market conditions did not improve . '\" Every week three or four people present themselves transgender the Regional Gender Identity and Psychosexual Service Knockbracken Belfast . The panel will address trans-phobic hate crime and access health and education .", "The new world was found our Solar System , 100 light-years away . It 's been named 51 Eridani b and is only 20 million years old - very young astronomical standards . The alien world could give us more information the formation our Solar System . The find was made the Gemini Planet Imager ( GPI ) , which looks young planets orbiting bright nearby stars . Our own Jupiter is the largest planet the solar system - it 's so big you could fit 1,300 Earths it ! It 's also the fastest rotating planet too , 1 day only lasting 10 hours - but a year Jupiter lasts 12 Earth years . Jupiter does n't have a solid surface and is made gas , giving it the name ' gas giant ' . The baby Jupiter has the strongest methane gas signature ever found an alien planet . The astronomers also detected water using the GPI 's spectrometer instrument . Scientists hope studying far away worlds , they can learn more how common the structure our Solar System is . Astronomers believe the gas giants our Solar System formed slowly - building a large core a few million years and then pulling in a huge amount hydrogen and other gases to form an atmosphere . This is known a \" cold-start \" . But the Jupiter-like planets that have been discovered so far are much hotter scientists have predicted . Which could mean they formed quickly - gas collapses to make a scorching planet what is known a ' hot-start ' .", "Kitchens , toilets and washing facilities haven been installed Tredegar Park the first demonstration expected Saturday , five days the summit . But what exactly will she be doing her time space ? The ISS gives the chance to do scientific experiments that cannot be done Earth , the station offers an environment microgravity . Here we run a few examples the experiments Samantha 's ' to do ' list ... Samantha will operate a gadget called an electromagnetic levitator , which can heat metals 2,000\u00c2 \u00b0 C and then cool them very quickly . This will be a chance to see what happens different metals when they go liquid solid , the effect the Earth 's gravity . It 's hoped the results will reveal more the physics the metals and how they work . Samantha will be testing new machine technology and how well they work space , such this astronaut joystick . Using a joystick space may feel very different space compared Earth . So these experiments will see how being space might affect how well an astronaut can control a space robot or space machinery . Another thing is equipment may need to be attached the astronaut it does n't float away . The testing will also see what impact this has . Samantha will be doing lots experiments to see how being space affects her body . example , she will experience 16 sunrises and sunsets every day the International Space Station and be tested to see how this affects her body clock . Another important subject is food and energy . Experiments to see how much food an astronaut would need a long mission will be carried . Samantha will record what she eats and her energy levels a period time . Other things that will be looked include how space affects skin and why many astronauts get headaches .", "Nether Edge Green Party councillor , Alison Teal , was served a legal notice her involvement protests Sheffield City Council 's tree felling programme . The Weald Kent girls' grammar school wants to open an annexe Sevenoaks . The Department Education ( DfE ) is considering the plans which have the backing Kent County Council . The law forbids the opening new grammar schools , but changes made the coalition government 2012 allow enlargement existing schools . \" I strongly support the right all good schools to expand . I think that 's very important and that should include grammar schools ,\" the prime minister said : \" this government grammar schools have been able to expand and that is all the good . \" Mr Cameron was responding a question the the proposed satellite grammar school Sevenoaks . But he would not be drawn when the government was likely to make its decision . \" the decision that the Department Education has to take , they have to take that having [ looked ] all the evidence and having proper consultations and making the decision proper time ,\" he added . Sevenoaks is the only major Kent town that does not have grammar provision . Bids made 2013 were turned the DfE said they did not comply the law . But the current plans put forward Weald Kent girls' grammar school are believed to have met the criteria . approved , the annexe could pave the way more grammars to open satellite campuses . General secretary the National Union Teachers , Christine Blower , has previously called the plans grammar school expansion \" yet another unnecessary distraction \" .", "The disorder HMP Erlestoke began Saturday when two inmates escaped their cells and threatened staff . It is a key element a package reforms promised Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi . The law seeks to end Italy 's post-war era revolving governments , political horse-trading and unstable coalitions . The lower house parliament gave final approval the bill 334 votes 61 . The proportional election system awards 340 630 seats any party that wins more 40 % the national vote . no party reaches that threshold , there is a second-round run-off the two parties the most votes . The electoral reform is expected to come force next year . the vote , Mr Renzi said : \" Commitment achieved , promise respected . Italy needs people who do n't always say no . \" Critics have accused the 40-year-old former mayor Florence who became prime minster last year trying to consolidate his grip power . They complain the law awards too much power single parties , gives party bosses too much scope to select candidates , and denies voters the chance to directly choose representatives . Opposition parties boycotted Monday 's vote . Renato Brunetta , parliamentary head centre-right opposition party Forza Italia , said afterwards it was \" a very ugly day our country 's democracy \" . Mr Renzi wants to further transform the Italian system abolishing the Senate and replacing it a non-elected body lesser powers . Subs not used : Pickford , Iorfa , Loftus-Cheek , Baker , Chilwell .", "He claims Universal Music have only paid the band a \" miniscule fraction \" the money they were owed downloads sites iTunes and Amazon . The musician is suing compensation , according legal documents filed Los Angeles Wednesday . The claim is also filed behalf his sister , Karen , who died 1983 . Carpenter hired accountants to examine financial statements Universal Music and its subsidiary , A & M Records , which has released The Carpenters' music their debut album 1969 . He says they found multiple errors , and the labels \" improperly classified \" revenue digital downloads The Carpenters' music sales physical records - which attract a lower royalty rate . He also claims digital downloads were undercounted . a statement , Carpenter said he had been unable to resolve the dispute suing . \" The Carpenters recordings are the best sellers the history popular music , and 48 years continue to contribute a substantial amount [ Universal 's ] annual bottom line ,\" he wrote . \" It seems only fair these companies account fairly my sister 's estate and me . \" Specialising radio-friendly soft rock , The Carpenters sold millions records the 1970s . The brother-sister duo won three Grammy Awards 1970 and 1971 , including best new artist and best vocal performance the ballad ( They Long to Be ) Close You . The band 's career was cut short when Karen developed anorexia nervosa 1975 . they continued to record , the condition eventually led her death , heart failure . Richard Carpenter 's legal claim is one many filed the US a 2010 court case involving Eminem , which resulted a ruling artists should receive higher royalty payments digital downloads they do when a CD or vinyl album is sold . The difference is substantial . According Billboard , artists get 15 % the money generated the sale a record . downloads , which are counted \" licensed content \" , the figure 50 % . Artists including Peter Frampton , Public Enemy , Whitesnake and The Temptations have all sued , or threatened to sue , order to obtain the higher rate . Universal Music were not immediately available to respond the latest case . Services will divert low-level platforms or Glasgow Central , bringing timetable changes and some cases , longer journey times . The work is part a \u00c2 \u00a3 60m upgrade project that will allow faster and longer trains to use the station . Passengers ScotRail 's main Edinburgh Glasgow service , Falkirk High , are being advised to travel Bathgate and Airdrie . That journey will take around 70 minutes . Phil Verster , managing director the ScotRail Alliance , said : \" Upgrading the tunnel will allow us to run faster , longer , greener trains the future . \" This will mean more seats , shorter journey times and less impact our environment . \" The long-term benefits this investment will be considerable , not just our railway , but also the country . \" ScotRail said the closure was necessary to enable major engineering work to renew 1,800m existing concrete slab track formation , which carries the rails the 918m tunnel . The firm said this was the largest engineering project undertaken the Edinburgh Glasgow , Falkirk High , railway , it was built . The project will involve 140 days continuous round-the-clock working , the removal 10,000 tonnes existing concrete slab and the installation 4,000m new rails . ScotRail has now launched a dedicated webpage to give passengers more information the impact the project . Transport Minister Derek Mackay said : \" This is a once a generation project and one the most ambitious ever planned the Edinburgh-Glasgow route . \" The works will support the introduction a new generation faster , quieter and greener electric trains routes the Central Belt next year . \" I understand this work will cause some inconvenience passengers , the ScotRail Alliance is working to ensure services are maintained where possible , disruption is kept a minimum and passengers are kept well informed the work . \"", "Media playback is not supported this device Al Hasawi , who took control the Reds the summer 2012 , would not reveal the identity the buyers . Christine Lagarde , managing director the IMF , described the talks finance ministers and central bankers Washington DC \" collective therapy \" to deal the gloomy prospects . But she said calmer financial markets February had reduced the nerves the IMF spring meeting . \" There was not exactly the same level anxiety but I think there was an equal level concern , and a collective endeavour to identify the solution and the responses the global economic situation ,\" she said . The IMF now predicts global growth 3.2 % this year and 3.5 % 2017 , having previously forecast 3.4 % and 3.6 % respectively . \" Downside risks the global economic outlook have increased October , raising the possibility a more generalised slowdown and a sudden pull-back capital flows ,\" the IMF steering committee said . It said countries' tax policies and public spending should be \" as growth-friendly possible \" . The total expenditure the two-year period came \u00a3 4.3bn , which led a gross value-added ( GVA ) boost the economy \u00a3 8.3bn . However , spending London was three times the rest the UK combined . The report said : \" The effect initial BBC spending is ' multiplied ' it ripples the economy region region and sector sector ( and the employees those sectors ) . This is known the ' multiplier effect '.\" The BBC 's chief economic and policy adviser Najma Rajah explained : \" The basic premise is when the BBC spends a pound , the impact that pound is ' multiplied ' that pound spent the BBC creates value elsewhere the economy . \" So , example , the BBC were to buy a camera a supplier Manchester , the camera supplier would receive some money return the camera . \" The camera company would then use the income generated the sale the camera to pay their suppliers the components that went the camera and to also pay their employees and so on . \" Rajah added : \" A really good example how this multiplier effect works is when the BBC commissions a programme that is made an independent television production . \" The programme might be filmed Scotland using local runners , electricians , make-up artists etc . who are paid and then will spend their wages Scotland the benefit the Scottish economy . \" The report revealed significant growth the north England following the opening the new BBC North headquarters Salford Quays , GVA growing 19.7 % \u00a3 391m . But the Midlands , it fell 21.7 % \u00a3 199m , the south was down 18.8 % \u00a3 699m and Wales dropped 6.2 % \u00a3 276m . London saw the biggest expenditure \u00a3 2.98bn - nearly three times as much the rest the UK combined - which turn generated \u00a3 5.65bn GVA . She was officially the last person born the 1800s still living . She had attributed her longevity her genetics and a diet three eggs a day , two them raw . Ms Morano was the oldest eight siblings , all whom she has outlived . She died her home the northern city Verbania . Her life not only spanned three centuries but also survived an abusive marriage , the loss her only son , two World Wars and more 90 Italian governments . Ms Morano had admitted her longevity was partly down genetics : her mother reached 91 and several sisters reached their centenary . But it was also down a rather unusual diet three eggs - two raw - each day more 90 years . It was a regime she took a young woman , the doctor diagnosed her anaemia shortly World War One . She had cut just two eggs a day , and a few biscuits recently . Her doctor 27 years , Carlo Bava , had told AFP news agency she rarely ate vegetables or fruit . \" When I met her , she ate three eggs day , two raw the morning and then an omelette noon , and chicken dinner . \" Ms Morano also credited her longevity her decision , 1938 , to kick her husband - a year her baby boy died just six months old . The marriage had never been healthy , she said . She had been love a boy who was killed World War One , and had no interest marrying someone else . But , she told La Stampa newspaper an interview when she was a spritely 112 she was left little choice . \" He told me : ' you 're lucky you marry me , or I 'll kill you ' . I was 26 years old . I got married . \" Eventually , it became too much . they separated 1938 , they remained married he died 1978 . Ms Morano , who worked she was 75 , chose never to marry again . \" I did n't want to be dominated anyone ,\" she told the New York Times . She had only taken a full-time carer a couple years ago - but had not left her small two-room apartment 20 years . According the US-based Gerontology Research Group ( GRG ) , the world 's oldest human being is now Jamaican Violet Brown , who was born March 10 , 1900 .", "Owens' team suffered a record European defeat they conceded nine tries a 64-14 Champions Cup hammering Paris . Next the Bairns is the visit Rangers Friday .", "Swansea University 's Dr Neil Loader and Emeritus Prof Alayne Street-Perrott , are a team who have found ancient earthworks , possibly 2,000 years old . The discoveries were made Acre state the western Brazilian Amazon . Researchers the universities Exeter and Reading , and Brazil 's S\u00c3 \u00a3 o Paulo , Bel\u00c3 \u00a9 m are also part the team . Their research investigated ditched enclosures which were concealed centuries bamboo-dominated rainforest modern deforestation allowed the discovery more 450 large geometrical \" geoglyphs \" . The team said the function these mysterious sites is still little understood . They are unlikely to be villages , archaeologists have recovered very few artefacts excavation , and their layout does not suggest they were built defensive reasons . Instead it is thought they were used only sporadically , perhaps ritual gathering places , similar the Maya pyramids Central America , or Britain 's own Stonehenge . Dr Loader - who has analysed soil samples the geoglyphs - said the surroundings which they were built were very different other ritual sites the world . He looked phytoliths - a type microscopic plant fossil made silica - to reconstruct ancient vegetation ; charcoal quantities , to assess the amount ancient forest burning ; and carbon stable isotopes , to indicate the type vegetation growing there the past . \" The indications are the geoglyphs were constructed taller vegetation . So , the towering Maya pyramids Central America , they were likely not visible the forest canopy , and this raises questions their purpose ,\" he explained . It had been assumed prior the arrival Europeans the early 16th Century , the Amazonian forests had been pristine ecosystems , free human influence . But the new research indicates a wide variety plant species spread 6,000 years , which could only have been artificially brought together humans . It suggested instead burning large tracts forest - either geoglyph construction or agricultural practices - people transformed their environment concentrating economically valuable trees such palms . The team have likened it a form \" prehistoric supermarket \" useful forest products . They said there is \" tantalizing evidence \" to suggest the biodiversity some Acre 's remaining forests may retain a strong legacy these ancient \" agroforestry \" practices this day .", "Two the songs come the Don Quixote musical Man La Mancha , which was a Broadway smash the 1960s . \" As far I am concerned , Don Quixote is the most metal fictional character that I know ,\" the Hobbit star said . \" Single handed , he is trying to change the world , regardless any personal consequences . Humpback sightings are not uncommon Scotland , but a large whale so far the Forth estuary is a lot more unusual . Police Scotland is warning boat owners to keep a safe distance the whale . Lindsay Kerr , Police Scotland wildlife liaison officer , said : \" This is a fantastic opportunity wildlife watchers and marine tourism but it is essential the health and well-being the animals is considered all times . \" The Forth estuary is subject large tidal changes and any disturbance the visiting whale could cause significant risk it becoming distressed and moving further shallow water and then becoming stranded a rapidly outgoing tide . \" Legislation is place to protect these marine mammals . Please enjoy this wonderful occurrence but do show respect the whales and be aware the protection afforded them . \" I recommend boat and vessel owners follow the Wildlife Safe ( WiSe ) scheme . this particular case , commercial and recreational users should not make any attempts to approach or actively pursue the whale . \" The scheme , which is a UK standard commercial marine wildlife watching , includes a code conduct and sets best practice wildlife watching . \" Endangered species such dolphins , porpoises and whales are protected wildlife legislation including the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 . the Act , it is an offence to intentionally or recklessly disturb them .", "Panthers kept their title hopes and closed the gap leaders Devils four points . Cameroon has rejected the accusation and said people returned willingly . According the UNHCR , more 2,600 refugees have been forcibly returned Nigeria Cameroon this year . Many are unable to go back their villages Borno state security reasons and have ended camps displaced people . some cases , the UNHCR said , people had been returned \" allowing them time to collect their belongings \" . Many the returnees are now settled the Banki camp internally displaced people . UNHCR staff also recorded about 17 people who claimed to be Cameroonian nationals , who it said had been deported mistake Banki . It is common the region to find people who have no documentary proof their nationality . Cameroonian Communications Minister Issa Tchiroma told the BBC 's Focus Africa programme : \" I strongly deny this accusation \" forced returns . He said the Cameroonian army had been working \" hand-in-hand \" the Nigerian army Boko Haram and any civilians who had returned Nigeria had done so their own accord . \" This repatriation has taken place willingly ,\" he said . The Cameroonian authorities have previously said Boko Haram militants have been entering the country disguised refugees . Militants have carried a number attacks northern Cameroon recent years , often using suicide bombers . The UNHCR said forced return constitutes a serious violation the 1951 Refugee Convention and the 1969 OAU Convention , both which Cameroon has ratified . The firm studied traffic hotspots 21 UK cities September 2016 . It assessed the impact the congestion looking the average duration traffic jams , their average length and the number times they occurred . Glasgow was ranked third the same list - worse Birmingham , Manchester and Bristol . It 's 357 hotspots could cost \u00a3 2.3bn the next 10 years , Inrix said . Researchers calculated the time wasted drivers traffic jams the UK could cost \u00a3 61.8bn 2025 congestion levels are not reduced . The inquest , which is expected to last three weeks , continues", "Accountant Bankruptcy ( AiB ) reported 2,405 insolvencies April and June - 7.8 % up the previous quarter . There were 1,144 bankruptcies , which was up 14.7 % the previous quarter and 51.1 % more a year ago . However , AiB said the figures showed a \" return trend \" . A year ago , the number personal insolvencies Scotland fell its lowest level more 14 years following the introduction the Bankruptcy and Debt Advice ( Scotland ) Act . The legislation introduced new measures such mandatory money advice people seeking access statutory debt relief solutions such sequestration . the latest bankruptcy figures were sharply up a year ago , they were 41.7 % lower the same quarter 2013-14 and 34.9 % lower 2014-15 . Personal insolvencies include both bankruptcies and protected trust deeds ( PTDs ) . The number PTDs recorded April and June remained largely stable 1,261 , a 2.1 % increase the previous quarter . New debt payment programmes approved the Debt Arrangement Scheme ( DAS ) fell slightly 5.2 % the previous quarter , 510 . Quarterly figures bankruptcies and PTDs 2005-06 : Business Minister Paul Wheelhouse said : \" These figures indicate people are becoming more accustomed the new insolvency legislation and processes . \" We are now seeing the numbers settling a more regular pattern following the significant , and expected , drop the introduction the new laws . \" Compared the same quarter two years ago , prior these changes , the number people falling insolvency today is down more a third . \" This shows those most need can access the debt relief they require to help them the road a fresh financial start - but also the long term movement is a downward one . \" Eileen Blackburn , insolvency trade body R3 , said : \" This quarterly rise , driven mostly an increase bankruptcies , bucks the wider downward trend Scottish personal insolvencies we 've seen past years . \" The number insolvencies have been falling steadily their peak 2012 , and this quarter represents a return more stable levels . \" The rise is probably less do the EU referendum result , which only happened the very end the quarter , and more to do ongoing difficulties the Scottish economy and the end the financial year March . \"", "One the 11 children described how the trailer went \" really fast the hill \" the farm Nottinghamshire it \" launched us \" . Arktos will eventually return an enclosure he shares the other male , Walker . RZSS said captive breeding was an important part a wider effort to conserve polar bears , which are classified \" vulnerable \" the International Union Conservation Nature 's Red List Threatened Species . However , animal welfare organisations OneKind Scotland and Born Free Foundation have said tackling climate change to better protect wild bears should be the focus conservation efforts rather captive breeding . RZSS , which also manages Edinburgh Zoo where efforts have been made to breed giant pandas , said Arktos and Victoria have mated several times so far . The society said the pair would live together the next week or two \" mimicking what would occur naturally the wild \" . Vickie Larkin , head carnivore keeper the park , said the pair had appeared to have bonded well being introduced . She said : \" Both polar bears have really warmed each other and all the signs are really positive . \" the first moment they met , Arktos has been really gentle Victoria and their bond has been immediate . \" Polar bear breeding is inherently complex the species are induced ovulators , meaning the female only releases an egg initial mating occurs . They also practice delayed implantation , where the egg does n't implant the uterine wall some months later . \" Ms Larkin added : \" successful , Victoria will not fall pregnant August September time . \" Other key stages are her entering the birthing den October November and potentially giving birth December January . Selling , buying and producing the drug will remain illegal and the move must still be ratified parliament . According the UN Office Drugs and Crime , almost 9 % Israelis use cannabis , some experts believe the figure to be higher . The move follows recommendations a committee set to study the issue , and moves a number US states and European nations to decriminalise use the drug . \" the one hand we are opening ourselves the future . the other hand , we understand the dangers and will try to balance the two ,\" Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told his cabinet ahead the vote . Israeli Justice Minister Ayelet Shaked said : \" Israel cannot shut its eyes the changes being made the world respect marijuana consumption and its effects . \" Meanwhile , Public Security Minister Gilad Erdan added the move was \" an important step the way implementing a new policy that will emphasise education and treatment instead criminal enforcement \" . the new system , first-time personal users who are caught and confess will be fined 1,000 shekels ( \u00c2 \u00a3 220 ; $ 270 ) , this doubling the second occasion . Probation will apply the third time and only a fourth case would lead criminal charges . It includes eight previously unreleased recordings , including the first broadcast Stairway Heaven , the BBC Paris Cinema London 1 April 1971 . Versions songs the band 's first two albums also feature , including Communication Breakdown and What Is And What Should Never Be . Formed 1968 , Led Zeppelin went on to become one the world 's biggest bands , each their studio albums making the top 10 the US Billboard charts . They officially split 1980 , following the death drummer John Bonham . There have been significant manufacturing job losses Northern Ireland the past year , including Michelin , JTI Gallahers and Bombardier .", "An IoD report , Ultrafast Britain , says the UK is lagging many European nations when installing fibre optic cables that enable the fastest broadband connections . It is calling faster broadband access homes and business . A government spokesperson said most UK homes can get \" superfast \" broadband . \" Almost nine ten UK properties has access superfast speeds and 95 % the UK will be reached 2017 ,\" a spokesperson the Department Culture , Media and Sport told the BBC . But the IoD believes the target should be higher and is calling speeds 10 gigabits second ( Gbps ) 2030 , 1,000 times faster the current official aim 10 megabits second ( Mbps ) 2020 . \" Now is the time to set a bold new target genuinely world-beating broadband ,\" said Dan Lewis , senior advisor Infrastructure Policy the IoD , and author the report . \" We have the leading internet economy the G20 , and yet download speeds are mediocre and the coverage fibre optic cable is woeful . \" He added : \" Unfortunately , the Government 's current target displays a distinct poverty ambition . \" Mr Lewis said the government needed to look how the UK could provide the physical infrastructure needed to maintain a position \" the forefront digital innovation business \" . IoD members interviewed the report said better broadband speeds could increase their company 's productivity , make them more competitive , and enable them to offer more flexible working their staff . The IoD report comes just days communications watchdog Ofcom said BT must open its cable network and allow competition to improve UK internet connections . Ofcom also said there was a digital divide the UK those the latest technologies , and those . It has proposed decent , affordable broadband should be a universal right . Rivals had called a split BT and its Openreach operation , which runs its cables , fibre and network infrastructure . Companies such Sky , Vodafone and TalkTalk , who pay to use the network , had claimed BT underinvested Openreach , leading a poor service interruptions and slow speeds .", "Fire , police and coastguard teams were called Butley Creek Orford , Suffolk , Wednesday a member the public who had seen the supine figure a man lying the water . The Bhutanese name Bhutan , Druk Yul , means \" Land the Thunder Dragon \" and it only began to open outsiders the 1970s . The Wangchuck hereditary monarchy has wielded power 1907 . But Bhutan became a two-party parliamentary democracy elections March 2008 . Population 750,000 Area 38,364 sq km ( 14,812 sq miles ) Major language Dzongkha Major religions Buddhism ( official ) , Hinduism Life expectancy 66 years ( men ) , 70 years ( women ) Currency ngultrum Head state : King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck succeeded his father , Jigme Singye Wangchuck , December 2006 the former monarch announced his abdication . His predecessor had already given some his absolute powers 1998 and ruled conjunction the government , an assembly and a royal advisory council . Prime Minister : Tshering Tobgay Tshering Tobgay was elected Bhutan 's second prime minister July 2013 , succeeding Jigme Yozer Thinley . He is president the People 's Democratic Party . He was leader the opposition the National Assembly March 2008 April 2013 . He has projected himself a reformer , rejecting official limousine and prime ministerial accommodation . Television did not come Bhutan 1999 . years , the country cut itself , fearing outside influences would undermine its monarchy and culture . Radio broadcasting began 1973 and the internet arrived 1999 . Some key dates the history Bhutan : 1720 - Chinese imperial army invades and temporarily establishes control Bhutan . 1772-73 - British intervention . 1864-65 - Further intervention Britain . 1907 - Ugyen Wangchuck is chosen hereditary ruler . 1910 - Treaty giving Britain control foreign relations . 1949 - Treaty signed newly-independent India guaranteeing non-interference Bhutan 's internal affairs , but allowing Delhi influence foreign relations . 1958 - Slavery abolished . 1974 - First foreign tourists allowed . 1990 - Thousands Hindus flee Nepal following clashes . 1998 - King cedes some powers national assembly .", "The 47-year-old Kerr , who presently coaches Stirling University 's Lowland League men 's side , will take Finland-bound Anna Signeul June . Days they met , a 6.3 magnitude quake struck the town the middle the night . Many L'Aquila's medieval buildings were destroyed , and some locals blamed the disaster committee not providing adequate advice . The prosecution can still seek to have the original verdicts reinstated a higher court .", "US experts found B3 , also known nicotinamide , boosts the ability immune cells to kill Staphylococcus bacteria . B3 increases the numbers and efficacy neutrophils , white blood cells that can kill and eat harmful bugs . The study , the Journal Clinical Investigation , could lead a \" major change treatment \" , a UK expert said . B3 was tested Staphylococcal infections , such the potentially fatal MRSA ( Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus ) . Such infections are found hospitals and nursing homes , but are also the rise prisons , the military and athletes . The scientists used extremely high doses B3 - far higher that obtained dietary sources - their tests , carried both animals and human blood . And the researchers say there is as yet no evidence dietary B3 or supplements could prevent or treat bacterial infections . The researchers say B3 appears to be able to \" turn \" certain antimicrobial genes , boosting the immune cells' killing power . Prof Adrian Gombart , Oregon State University 's Linus Pauling Institute , who worked the research , said : \" This is potentially very significant , we still need to do human studies . \" Antibiotics are wonder drugs , but they face increasing problems resistance various types bacteria , especially Staphylococcus aureus . \" This could give us a new way to treat Staph infections that can be deadly , and might be used combination current antibiotics . \" It 's a way to tap the power the innate immune system and stimulate it to provide a more powerful and natural immune response . \" Prof Mark Enright , the University Bath , said : \" Neutrophils are really the front line infections the blood and the use nicotinamide seems safe this dose to use patients it is already licensed use . \" This could cause a major change treatment infections conventional antibiotics to help bolster patients immune system . \" I would like to see patient clinical trials but cannot see why this could n't be used straight away infected patients . \"", "The review 22 abuse cases Northern Ireland criticised the authorities not doing enough . Thursday 's report , examining the PSNI response , has been published the Safeguarding Board Northern Ireland . The move follows a five-month trial the run-up the General Election . \" its sister programme 6 , The BBC 's 10 o'clock News is already the most popular news bulletin the UK and , the New Year , it will offer even more ,\" said Gavin Allen , controller daily news programmes . \" Viewers will continue to see the fullest range stories - and now we 'll have still more scope to explain the events that impact the country and help to make sense the changing world us . \" It 's always been a bit odd the BBC 's highest profile news bulletin ( not highest rated - the audience the Six o'clock News is bigger ) has also been the shortest . Of course , the official duration has n't always been stuck . People who tune just the weather the end the bulletin will already know this - the news is sometimes two , three or even five minutes longer it says the schedules . It is , though , an interesting symbolic move . ITV 's News Ten presenter Tom Bradby has questioned the BBC scheduling its main news 10pm , and so too has the culture secretary John Whittingdale . This certainly makes clear the BBC is n't planning vacating the spot , but is digging even deeper . Yet it does present a quandary those who like to tuck Newsnight the Ten . Newsnight 's start time is usually 22:32 . future , you stay the News Ten the end the weather , you will have missed the first 13 minutes the programme . And finally , fans the red chair and the celebrity sofa , this is a Monday Thursday-only change . The move comes renewed demand old-fashioned black plastic records , which now occupy a key market niche . one time , the format had been expected to disappear the rise CDs , digital downloads and streaming . vinyl 's long decline the late 1980s onwards , many vinyl record factories closed , production confined a few specialist independent firms . But this year , global vinyl revenue is expected to hit $ 1bn ( \u00c2 \u00a3 770m ) , many consumers swearing its supposedly superior sound quality . Analysis : Jonty Bloom , business correspondent They said the CD had killed it and digital downloads had left it dead and buried : but vinyl is back . Sony , which played a major part killing vinyl developing CDs , has seen them replaced turn other music technology such downloads and streaming , but vinyl is increasingly popular once again . The format has been saved a resurgence demand , it attracts not only nostalgic older consumers , but also younger generations who have rediscovered records , especially clubs and music festivals . Sony is even struggling to find older engineers who know how to make records . Part the reason the popularity vinyl records may be you can actually sell them shops . the UK , record sales brought more money last year streaming platforms - the unit costs vinyl is many times that streaming . Vinyl records have been growing popularity again recent years , boosted events such Record Store Day April every year , which record companies produce special limited-edition singles and albums . Sony 's move comes a few months it equipped its Tokyo studio a cutting lathe , used to produce the master discs needed manufacturing vinyl records . It has not yet said which titles it will be pressing vinyl , but big sellers the format these days are a mixture classic back-catalogue items and modern releases new bands .", "Victoria mated a male bear the Highland Wildlife Park Kincraig , Aviemore , earlier this year . The nutrient keeps bones strong , and protects conditions osteoporosis . The guidance was drawn it is thought fears skin cancer have made people too cautious being the sun . Cancer Research UK and the National Osteoporosis Society are the bodies which agree \" little and frequent \" spells summer sunshine several times a week can benefit your health . The experts now say it is fine to go outside strong sun the middle the day , as long you cover or apply sunscreen your skin goes red . Professor Rona Mackie , the British Association Dermatologists , said : \" Total sun protection high factor suncream all the time is not ideal , terms vitamin D levels . \" Even Australia has changed its policy this . They 're now producing charts showing parts Australia where sun protection may not be required some parts the year . \" Some the messages sun exposure have been too negative . UK summer sunshine is n't desperately strong . We do n't have many days the year when it is very intense . \" What 's changed is we 're now saying exposure 10 15 minutes the UK summer sun , suncream , several times a week is probably a safe balance adequate vitamin D levels and any risk skin cancer . \" Official government advice already recommends vitamin D supplements pregnant women and children aged five . But the experts who wrote the joint statement say mothers often are not made aware this recommendation . They suggest women consult their GP . Winter levels vitamin D can be helped a break the tropical sun - or eating oily fish , liver and fortified margarine . Cancer Research UK 's chief clinician , Professor Peter Johnson , said : \" A good diet and sensible sun exposure will be adequate the great majority the UK population to minimise their cancer risk . \" The area vitamin D and cancer is complex . \" There 's some evidence , which is strongest bowel cancer , low levels vitamin D the blood correlate the risk developing cancer . \" But that does n't mean those low levels cause bowel cancer . \" We think overall low levels vitamin D are unlikely to be major contributors the chances developing cancer the UK population . \" The joint statement also highlighted questions vitamin D that warrant further research . England are due to tour Bangladesh to play two Tests and three one-day internationals October and November 2016 .", "Cryptococcus neoformans is a fungus that can cause a fatal infection people weakened immune systems - particularly those advanced HIV . Birds are known to carry the fungus , experts puzzled why the birds themselves do not appear to become ill . Research has found a blood cell called a macrophage can block its growth . The fungus , found bird 's droppings , mostly infects the lungs or the central nervous system . Scientists the University Sheffield and the University Birmingham found it can grow slowly the bird 's digestive tract , but it tries to invade the bird 's body the immune system immediately destroys it . Dr Simon Johnston , who led the research , said : \" Birds have a higher body temperature humans , but this alone is not enough to fully stop the fungus . \" studying bird cells the microscope , we have seen macrophage cells have the ability to completely block the growth the fungus , which can be fatal humans . He added : \" we can learn how some animals are able to resist infection we might be able to gain insights how we can improve the human immune response this fungus . \" The universities said the work was part a larger international effort to help fight cryptococcosis . The findings are reported the journal Scientific Reports .", "The flight Manchester Airport Agadir Morocco , was diverted London Gatwick less an hour take-off Thursday . Lives could depend police forces continuing to get access the data devices used criminals and terrorists , he said . The FBI was talking both Apple and Google its fears , said Mr Comey . The conversations tech firms needed to be had the day when police forces lost access those devices , he said . \" I 'd hate to have people look me and say , ' Well how come you ca n't save this kid ? ' ' How come you ca n't do this thing ?'\" said Mr Comey a briefing . His comments came reaction a decision Apple to enable a file encryption system its iOS 8 software which it has no keys . This means it would not be able to comply any official request to help police get the data those devices . Google has said it too is planning to enable a similar encryption system default the next version Android . Mr Comey said he was \" very concerned \" these plans what they would allow people to do . \" What concerns me this is companies marketing something expressly to allow people to place themselves the law ,\" he said . \" I am a huge believer the rule law , but I am also a believer no-one this country is the law ,\" he added . Apple and Google have yet to respond Mr Comey 's comments . Ten days prior Mr Comey 's press statement , iOS data forensics expert Jonathan Zdziarski pointed Apple 's encryption system would not stop police getting data portable devices . Specifically weakening security systems just to aid the police was a bad decision , he said . \" the sake privacy and overall security , the only logical solution is to make products as secure possible , and let good detective work do the crime solving , rather an easy button ,\" he wrote a blogpost .", "Cheap miniature versions the unmanned aircraft used the military could fall the wrong hands , he told the UK 's Guardian newspaper . The service will be available all terrestrial viewers and may also be offered satellite , cable and online . Ofcom said it will decide successful applicants this autumn , the new channels expected to launch next year . Licences will be awarded based a set criteria including the provision local news and current affairs , programme proposals , launch date and commercial viability . The 21 areas Ofcom have selected local TV are : Belfast , Birmingham , Brighton & Hove , Bristol , Cardiff , Edinburgh , Glasgow , Grimsby , Leeds , Liverpool and London . Manchester , Newcastle , Norwich , Nottingham , Oxford , Plymouth , Preston , Sheffield , Southampton and Swansea will also benefit the service . The areas were selected having sufficient levels interest potential operators and being technically capable receiving a local TV service . The court is also expected to hear a defence request to abolish what they term a \" presumptive classification \" that treats any discussion the CIA prisons top secret , as well a media request to limit closing the courtroom secret sessions . Judge Pohl ultimately ruled the defendants would not be forced to attend hearings scheduled to run the end this week , but did not rule further pre-trial hearings . However , this has never been activated and Easter has remained variable , determined the moon 's cycle . Easter is the most important Christian festival , it celebrates the resurrection Jesus Christ following his death crucifixion Good Friday . The archbishop said he was talks Pope Francis , Coptic leader Pope Tawadros , and the leader the Orthodox church Patriarch Bartholomew . Mr Welby said he hoped the change would happen \" five and 10 years time \" . \" I would love to see it I retired \" , he said , he warned the first attempt to make such a change was the 10th Century . An Anglican source told the BBC there had been 15 attempts to agree a common date then . Easter is the first Sunday the first ecclesiastical full moon following the spring equinox , meaning it can be celebrated a Sunday 22 March and 25 April . But the Orthodox church follows the Julian calendar , hence has later Easter celebrations compared those Western Christianity . 1990 , the Vatican approved a proposal a fixed date , which was subject agreement other Christian churches and governments . Subscribe the BBC Sport newsletter to get our pick news , features and video sent your inbox .", "A stake a local energy business could cost just \u00c2 \u00a3 5 , and the industry says it could generate an annual return 6 % and 9 % . The scheme aims to reduce local opposition renewable energy development . It has been developed the renewable industry community groups . The Shared Ownership Taskforce plan follows similar programmes Denmark which have been running more two decades . It applies anything entering the planning system Monday . More 70 % people the UK nationally say they like wind farms , according a government survey . However , proximity often provokes a different response and the wind farms are frequently considered a blot the landscape . The government previously insisted wind farm developers should give local communities \u00c2 \u00a3 5,000 a year every megawatt energy installed - to support local initiatives . The taskforce goes further insisting any new applications entering the planning system must offer to sell part their business locals - somewhere 5 and 25 % . This can be the form directly-owned shares , crowd-funding or debentures . Nina Skorupska , Chief Executive , Renewable Energy Association welcomes the plan . She told BBC News : \" Elsewhere Europe this is commonplace , so we 're very pleased the UK is also working this vision a more open energy market . \" The scheme has been promoted the Energy and Climate Change Secretary , Edward Davey . He said : \" Community energy is revolutionising renewable energy development the UK , and shared ownership will offer people the opportunity to buy the green energy that their own communities are producing . \" The Vice-Chair the Taskforce and an associate Co-operatives UK , Rebecca Willis , said : \" We know our experience grass roots level there 's a substantial appetite local communities to invest renewable energy . \" There are , though , still likely to be areas where local people will prefer to keep their uninterrupted view to cash a regular dividend cheque . Local groups facing shale gas developments their area may regard the renewables scheme interest . Prof Peter Field , a renowned expert Arthurian literature , said : \" It was quite chance . I was looking some maps , and suddenly all the ducks lined . \" I believe I may have solved a 1,400-year-old mystery . \" Previous best guesses the location the round table include Caerleon Newport , Somerset 's Cadbury Castle , and Tintagel Cornwall . Roman times , Slack was home a fort called Camulodunum , which means \" the fort the god Camul \" . the years , well-recognised linguistic processes would have reduced Camulodunum Camelot . almost forgotten and insignificant today , and even it was abandoned and dilapidated the relevant time King Arthur A.D . 500 , Prof Field argues this site Slack would still have been considered a strategic stronghold . that time , Celtic-speaking Britons , who could have been led King Arthur , held the north and the west coast the invading Anglo-Saxons . Slack , the Roman road Chester York , would have been the ideal location which to defend the east coast . Prof Field added : \" there was a real King Arthur , he will have lived AD500 , the first mention him Camelot is a French poem the Champagne region France 1180 . \" There is no mention Camelot the period those dates , known the Dark Ages , when the country was war , and very little was recorded . \" this gap , people passed information , much got lost transmission , and people may have made facts or just messed known information . \" Prof Field , who taught Bangor 1964 2004 , has been researching the location Camelot the past 18 months . They were dropped Nant Peris the MRT walked the peak .", "The Home Office decided to halt the Detained Fast Track ( DFT ) system concerns safeguards , particularly \" vulnerable applicants \" . Immigration minister James Brokenshire said he hoped the DFT system would resume weeks . It is thought 800 applicants are affected - and can now seek bail . those , it is estimated about 100 may have to be released . The system , introduced 2000 , accelerates legal hearings and appeals keeping the individual detained . It is used cases which officials believe can be decided quickly . Last month the Court Appeal ordered the Home Office to halt the system immediately an earlier High Court hearing concluded it contained \" structural unfairness \" . High Court judge Mr Justice Nicol put a \" legal stay \" - a temporary delay - his ruling 12 June , following a case brought campaign group Detention Action . This meant the fast-track system remained operation the government had exhausted all opportunities to appeal . BBC home affairs correspondent Danny Shaw said officials were worried their procedures were not as robust they should be . a statement the House Commons , Mr Brokenshire said the system had \" come significant legal challenge \" . \" Risks surrounding the safeguards the system particularly vulnerable applicants have also been identified the extent we cannot be certain the level risk unfairness certain vulnerable applicants who may enter DFT . \" light these issues , I have decided to temporarily suspend the operation the detained fast-track policy . \" I hope this pause to be short duration , perhaps only a matter weeks , but I will only resume operation this policy when I am sure the right structures are place to minimise any risk unfairness . \" The decision to suspend the process means those asylum seekers detained and awaiting hearings will be reassessed a \" senior level \" to see they can be released detention to continue their asylum application the normal way . Mr Brokenshire added : \" Those who meet the general criteria detention will not be directly affected the decision to suspend DFT . \" Many are already detained these powers , example they are risk absconding and face imminent removal . \" Only detention can no longer be justified a DFT process will applicants be released to continue their asylum claim the regular asylum system . \" He said applicants who face removal a safe third country , pose a risk the public or are foreign offenders are \" still liable to be detained or remain detained \" . The DFT system accelerated some 4,300 asylum applications or decisions 2013 . It currently processes 30 40 cases a week .", "Aamir Siddiqi , 17 , was stabbed his home Roath 2010 and two men , Jason Richards and Ben Hope , were jailed life 2013 . The Chilean flag its white star a blue background resembles that the Lone Star state . Tom Oliverson said the resolution was meant to be mainly educational . The resolution calls lawmakers \" to reject the notion the Chilean flag , it is a nice flag , can any way compare or be substituted the official state flag Texas and urge all Texans not to use the Republic Chile flag emoji digital forums when referring the Lone Star Flag the great State Texas \" . Some Texans have developed a habit using the Chilean flag text messages and social media a sign national pride . None the US states currently have their own emoji flag . Mr Oliverson said the idea was to raise awareness the mix-up a light-hearted manner . \" Even the legislature decides not to hear it , we have achieved our objective ,\" he said . The resolution would be non-binding and cannot pass law . There will be no penalties using the wrong flag emoji . \" The Chilean flag is a fine design . Maybe it 's the second best flag , who knows , we 're not getting a contest here . The important thing , though , is it 's not the Texas flag ,\" joked writer Dan Solomon Texas Monthly magazine . \" these divided times , we anticipate this bit legislative silliness will be a refreshing breath bipartisanship ,\" he concluded . It leads the progressive deterioration mobility , health and stamina . Her friend Kyle Pirrie has started a petition seeking to see the medicine Vimizim made available the NHS . There is no known cure Morquio syndrome but the drug improves the life people the condition . It replaces a missing enzyme which allows children to continue to grow , as well improving stamina and the ability to walk . It also relieves pain . The drug 's manufacturers have been providing the treatment patients their own expense but they are going to withdraw it the NHS England and Scotland commit funding it . The Stranraer Academy student said her life would be markedly different the drug . \" I would n't be able to move I 'd just be so much pain ,\" she said . \" And I probably would n't be able to go school . \" It was that situation which prompted her friend to launch the petition which now has nearly 2,000 signatures . \" a friend I suppose I felt kind of bad she was going to be denied this I know she has got a great outlook life ,\" Kyle explained . \" She 's funny , she 's friendly and I would hate to see her pain all the time . \" Galloway and West Dumfries MSP Alex Fergusson has also backed the petition . \" This is not a cheap medication but , Katie herself asked me , how do you put a value a human life ?\" he asked . \" There are only just a hundred sufferers the UK , just five Scotland , and those who have had treatment Vimizim report a massive reduction pain and the other symptoms this syndrome . \" Life expectancy , which rarely exceeds the mid 20s treatment , can be considerably extended this treatment , and it is enormously the credit Katie and her friends they have raised this petition to try to ensure the treatment is available all . \" The Scottish Medicines Consortium said the drug was currently going its assessment process . A 6 % increase the haddock catch 40,711 tonnes gives the UK an additional 3,468 tonnes and Scottish fishermen more 2,500 extra tonnes . Charter is also buying Bright House Networks , another cable operator , $ 10.4bn . The combined three firms will serve cable television and broadband 23.9 million customers 41 states . Charter will pay about $ 55bn cash and stock Time Warner Cable , the balance the $ 78.7bn valuation coming TWC 's debts . US cable companies are facing stiff competition online service providers such Amazon and Netflix , customers increasingly choose to stream films and television shows the internet a time their convenience . Cable companies are responding trying to cut costs and improve the quality their shows . The new merged cable giant will compete US cable market leader Comcast , which currently has 27 million customers . Charter 's takeover move comes a month Comcast abandoned its plan to buy Time Warner Cable fearing pressure regulators . The latest deal is also likely to come regulatory scrutiny , and the Federal Communications Commission ( FCC ) quickly issued a statement . \" The FCC reviews every merger its merits and determines it would be the public interest ,\" FCC chairman Tom Wheeler said . \" applying the public interest test , an absence harm is not sufficient . The commission will look to see how American consumers would benefit the deal were to be approved . \" The merged company would still be smaller Comcast , which serves a third US broadband customers , said analyst Craig Moffett Moffett Nathanson Research . \" One has to be sober genuine risks this deal could still be rejected ,\" he added . Liberty Broadband , which currently owns a quarter Charter , is expected to own 20 % the new company . However , Evan Lucas IG Markets Melbourne said \" the collapse [ Australian stocks ] the back the RBA not having an explicit easing bias ... was a bit an overreaction \" . May , the RBA cut its benchmark lending rate 25 basis points an all-time low 2 % . Rising property prices Australia 's biggest city , Sydney , a strong currency and a drop iron ore prices were the reasons the cut . The May rate cut was the second this year , following a previous 25 basis point cut February and followed similar action central banks China , Canada , Singapore , Korea and India . A rising Australian dollar had also been cause concern , particularly Australia 's big mining and energy exporters . Mr Oliver said more help would likely to be required \" the form an even lower Australian dollar - and to ensure this happens the RBA may yet still have to cut interest rates further record low territory . \"", "But the summer visitor is decline and , according a new study , its migratory habits may be to blame . Scientists have tagged birds leaving the UK and believe they take two different routes their journey to spend the winter Africa . Surprisingly , survival is lower the shorter route Spain , they report the journal , Nature Communications . And this suggests migration - as well other factors such loss farmland and insect food - may be to blame the cuckoo 's decline . More half cuckoos the UK have been lost the past 20 years , according the British Trust Ornithology ( BTO ) Norfolk , which led the research . \" That pattern starting the same place but taking two very different routes to get there has not been seen before any birds , the best our knowledge ,\" said lead researcher Dr Chris Hewson . \" We need to understand the full annual cycle a migratory bird order to understand its population decline . \" Facts the common cuckoo Source : British Library / RSPB / BTO 2011 , the BTO has been satellite-tracking cuckoos to study their migration patterns when they leave the UK . Working the University Copenhagen , the charitable research institute used satellite tags to track 42 male common cuckoos the UK population more 50 autumn migrations . The researchers found birds declining populations were more likely to migrate winter breeding grounds central Africa a western route ( Spain ) an eastern route ( Italy and the Balkans ) . The higher mortality occurred reaching the harsh environment the Sahara desert , the fact the western route is about a tenth shorter this point . The scientists think birds may have encountered challenging drought conditions Spain . Alternatively , they may have been deprived insect food such hairy caterpillars leaving the UK , leaving them lower fat stores their hazardous journey . Migratory bird species are increasingly threatened the world factors including climate change , habitat change and habitat loss . Migratory birds ' lack world protection ' Understanding where mortality occurs their annual cycles is therefore increasingly important , especially long-distance migratory land birds , which show some the steepest population declines , say the scientists . Fred Ortega , a spokesman Prime Healthcare Services , which owns Chino Valley Medical Center and Desert Valley Hospital , said : \" It did cause significant disruptions our IT systems . \" However , most the systems and the critical infrastructure has been brought back online . \" The attack comes weeks it was revealed Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Centre Los Angeles had been attacked ransomware . that case , it paid $ 17,000 to get access files back . Kentucky Methodist Hospital information systems director Jamie Reid named the malware involved Locky , a new bug that encrypts files , documents and images and renames them the extension . locky . The most common way Locky gets itself machines is a spam email an attached document that looks nonsense and advises readers to enable macros \" the data encoding is incorrect \" . the malware is downloaded , it sends a message desktops instructions how users can pay to have files unlocked . November , a report Intel 's McAfee labs said the number ransomware attacks was expected to grow 2016 . Sayers has told the Guardian she would be \" gutted \" she did not receive her medal the World Championships this summer .", "People a DNA variation a gene called PDSS2 tend to drink fewer cups coffee , a study carried the University Edinburgh has found . It suggests the gene reduces cell ability to break caffeine . This causes it to stay the body longer and means those the gene get the same caffeine hit less coffee . One scientist working the project said it suggests the \" drive to drink coffee may be embedded our genes \" . The researchers studied the DNA 370 people living a small village southern Italy and 843 people six villages north-east Italy . The subjects were asked to complete a survey including a question how many cups coffee they drank each day . The team found people the PDSS2 DNA variation tended to consume fewer cups coffee people the variation - equivalent one fewer cup daily average . Researchers replicated the study a group 1,731 people the Netherlands . The result was similar but the effect the gene the number cups coffee consumed was slightly lower . The scientists said the change could be down the different styles coffee drunk the two countries . Italy , people tend to drink smaller cups such espresso the Netherlands the preference is larger cups which contain more caffeine overall . Dr Nicola Pirastu , a Chancellor 's Fellow the University Edinburgh , said : \" The results our study add existing research suggesting our drive to drink coffee may be embedded our genes . \" We need to do larger studies to confirm the discovery and also to clarify the biological link PDSS2 and coffee consumption . \" The study is published the journal Scientific Reports and was conducted the universities Edinburgh and Trieste , the Burlo Garofolo Pediatric Institute Italy , the Erasmus Medical Centre and PolyOmica , a data analysis company based Groningen , the Netherlands .", "Its parliament approved the sending a formal invitation , which he has to accept ascending the throne . The deeply revered King Bhumibol Adulyadej died 13 October , plunging Thailand mourning . The prince was widely expected to succeed his father , but officials had earlier said he wanted to postpone it least a year . The official reason given was he wanted to give the Thai people time to mourn his father he became king . Correspondents say Thailand was left an odd constitutional limbo the prince , the undisputed heir , should have succeeded his father immediately . the past doubts have been expressed senior officials how the crown prince can perform the role played his father 70 years . The monarchy occupies a pivotal place Thailand 's political order . King Bhumibol Adulyadej had been seen a unifying figure periods political unrest , including the most recent military coup 2014 . The leader Thailand 's parliament , the National Legislative Assembly , is expected to meet the crown prince the next few days to formally invite him . the crown prince accepts , his succession would then be announced the public . But it is still not clear when that will happen . Former Prime Minister Prem Tinsulanonda is currently standing regent . Thailand has rarely had what might be called routine royal successions . The last was 70 years ago , when the young King Ananda was found shot dead his bedroom still unexplained circumstances . When he died , an emergency session parliament that night named his grief-stricken brother Bhumibol king . private speculation the prospects his popular sister Princess Sirindhorn , Crown Prince Vajiralongkorn has been the undisputed heir the throne his formal investiture 1972 . Thai succession law follows the principle primogeniture , where the throne should pass the eldest son the reigning king , but it also gives the king the discretion to name his own choice . King Bhumibol never wavered his endorsement the crown prince . But the crown prince 's unexpected decision to delay taking the throne has made this yet another succession which has departed the script . His real reasons are not known ; public mourning his father would not have been affected had he been anointed immediately his father 's death .", "The East Antrim MP had been considering putting his name forward Nigel Dodds ruled himself . Many people are changing the way they connect Tor to avoid the block . Activists said the block moved Turkey 's net censorship policies \" moderate \" \" severe \" . Tor , also known The Onion Router , aims to conceal where people go online using encryption and randomly bouncing requests webpages a network different computers . The system has become popular many nations , such China and Turkey , where governments are known to watch what people do and say online . Now Turkey Blocks , which monitors internet censorship the nation , said its regular monitoring Tor showed it was being widely blocked the country . The organisation started to investigate many people Turkey reported having problems reaching the Tor network . It added the Turkish government had put place sophisticated systems ISPs to spot when people were trying to connect Tor . These inspect packets data and can pick the distinctive signature those that are destined Tor . Turkey Blocks said the Turkish government ordered firms to start blocking VPNs and Tor early December , and has increased the pressure firms to act asking weekly updates the success the measures . The monitoring group said direct access Tor was not working well , many people were reporting they could still access the network they used a bridge . These are unofficial entry points the Tor network which , they are not listed the software itself , can survive when blocks are imposed . Turkey has a long history cutting access websites and services - particularly periods social unrest .", "The Uruguayan , 25 , was signed Nacional two years ago but made just six league appearances Boro , three them a substitute . Many say they 've never known it so tough . The slump global oil prices has hit Nigeria hard . The government depends oil sales about 70 % its revenues . But critics say government policies made a bad situation even worse . The decision to delay devaluing Nigeria 's currency meant many businesses struggled to get foreign currency to pay imports , which had a cooling effect the entire economy . Following enormous pressure , the government changed tack this summer , allowing the naira to float . That 's led a spike inflation , but the hope is it will attract foreign investors .
